scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: North Vietnamese and Viet Cong propaganda directed at American soldiers in Vietnam. Herz's original numbering, arrangement, and descriptions have largely been maintained.

did.unittitle: 1) "A CORPORAL OF THE FIRST U.S. INF. DIV. DESERTED AND WENT TO THE LIBERATED REGION OF LONGAN PROVINCE"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: "...Since he (Corporal McKinley Nolan)...became an eyewitness pillages and devastating of villages, barbarous killings and miserable defeats of U.S. aggressors,...courageously he decided the far well to the troops,...was warmly welcome by V.N. people...and is well treating by the N.F.L. that makes all conditions to assist him according to his will."
Includes Vietnamese translation.

did.unittitle: 2) "DEAR FRIENDS OF AMERICAN ARMED FORCES IN SOUTH VIETNAM"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Deserter statement: "I am Mc Kinley Nolan...I have been treated well since I crossed over to the South Vietnamese people and its liberation combatants' side...I do think this war waged by our government is nothing but an aggressive war..."

did.unittitle: 2A) "G.I's OF THE 1st AND 25th INFANTRY DIVISION!"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Deserter statement: "My name Mc Kinley Nolan...To contribute your efforts to the American people's struggle for an early end to this dirty aggressive war...you should:
- Demand for peace, an end to the war!
- Demand for your home return now!..."
Includes Vietnamese translation.

did.unittitle: 3) "RALLIED MAN NOLAN TO 1st AND 25th INFANTRYMEN!"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Same as 2A, in Nolan's handwriting.

did.unittitle: 3A) "FELLOW AMERICAN SOLDIERS"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Deserter statement: "My name is JOHN PETER JOHNSON...I have crossed over to the Liberation Armed Forces Side. I acted on my own free will. I believe in the policy of the Front is just...I am sure I will be released soon. So I can tell the people back home and other countries about the patriotic struggle of the Vietnamese people...Get out of this hell of a War before it is too late..." (John Peter Johnson's signature).

did.unittitle: 4) "P.O.W. SMITH TO G.I's"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Prisoner of war's statement: "To my fellow servicemen! I am Donald Smith...I am lucky I was captured by S.V.N.N.L.F. At least I am still alive to someday return home...We must oppose the Johnson Administration and its policy...War is not a pleasant thing for you or your parents to go through so let's stay home where we belong."
In Smith's handwriting. Includes Vietnamese translation. Smith was subsequently released.

did.unittitle: 5) "STATEMENT OF THREE U.S. PRISONERS OF WAR..."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: "Statement of three U.S. prisoners of war released on the occasion of the 8th anniversary of the founding of the SVNNLF (Dec. 20, 1968)." (Donald G. Smith; Thomas Nelson Jones; James W. Brigham)

did.unittitle: 5A) "THOMAS N. JONES' IMPRESSIONS"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: "Thomas N. Jones' impressions when he was released by the S.V.N.N.L.F. on Dec. 20, 1968."
Includes Vietnamese translation.

did.unittitle: 5B) "JAMES W. BRIGHAM'S IMPRESSIONS"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: "James W. Brigham's impressions when he was released by the S.V.N.N.L.F. on Dec. 20, 1968."
Includes Vietnamese translation.

did.unittitle: 6) a. "TO AFRO-AMERICAN G.I's!"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: "...Where is the enemy of Luther King as well as of all Afro-Americans? Not here in Vietnam, but right in the U.S.A.!...Americans, return home to solve your living and civil-right problems!..."

did.unittitle: 6) b. "The Vietnam War is a 'hell hole of racism for the Negroes GIs over and above the usual hell of war'..."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: "...Your real enemies are those who call you 'Niggers'. Your genuine struggle is on your native land. GO HOME NOW AND ALIVE!"

did.unittitle: 6A) a. "WHERE IS THE BATTLEFIELD OF COLORED AMERICANS?"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: "Colored G.I's! Black leader Stokely Carmichael has said: 'Our enemy is not the Vietnamese people...'...It is necessary for you to return home now to struggle for the liberation of colored people of America."
Includes Vietnamese translation.

did.unittitle: 6A) b. "HOW 'DEMOCRACY' OPERATES"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: "11 percent of the U.S. population are Negroes.
30 percent of the G.I's in Vietnam are Negroes.
40 percent of G.I. deaths in Vietnam are Negroes.
If you're reading this, you're one of the 30 percent.
Stay out of the 40 percent column!
GO HOME!"
Includes cartoon on reverse side.

did.unittitle: 6B) "US ARMYMEN - NEGRO ARMYMEN"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: "On April 4 -1968, the racists assassinated Mr. Martin Luther King...Do act according to Mr. King's teaching: 'We fight against racial discrimination not against the combatants of freedom and independence in Vietnam.' Don't die in vain in Vietnam! Don't interfere on the Vietnamese's internal affair..."

did.unittitle: 6C) "American Negro soldiers!"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: "Unite with Vietnamese people in the struggle against our common enemy, the US ruling circles..." (may not have been disseminated).

did.unittitle: 6D) "A POEM FROM AN AMERICAN GI OF THE 4 INF DIVISION"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: 2 identical leaflets: Recto: "I am a soldier and black is my skin..."

Verso: "Floyd B. McKissick, National Director of CORE (Congress of Racial Equality) says: '...the colored peoples over there (Asia) are fighting for the same thing that we're fighting for. They see the U.S. as an aggressor...'"

did.unittitle: 6E) a. Same as 6D
6E) b. Same as 6D; includes cartoon on reverse side
6F) "STILL THE CHAMPION!!! MUHAMMED ALI, WORLD CHAMPION AND A REAL HERO"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Recto: "'I refuse to be inducted into the Armed Forces of the United States...'"
Verso: "Captain Howard Levy, a true American and a doctor with a conscience: 'The United States is wrong in being involved in the Vietnam war...'"

did.unittitle: 6G) "EVER HEARD THIS LITTLE DITTY?"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: "'I wish I were an Alabama trooper
That is what I would truly like to be
I wish I were an Alabama trooper
Cause then I could kill the niggers legally'

In America, the black people have constantly had the doom of SECONDCLASS CITIZENS and of being KILLED LEGALLY by the racists, as has proven by this extremely reactionary ditty being openly circulated in the U.S...."
Includes Vietnamese translation.

did.unittitle: 6H) "BLACK GI's!"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: "...Not a single black life for the American imperialists' war of aggression in Vietnam!..."

did.unittitle: 7) "THE CENTRAL TRUNG BO NATIONAL FRONT FOR LIBERATION SET FREE TWO U.S. PRISONERS OF WAR" (2 Puerto Ricans)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: "...After having showed progress in study and education and repent over their past crimes committed against the Vietnamese people, they are allowed to return home to work and live with their families..."

did.unittitle: 8) "American GI's OF THE 25th INFANTRY DIVISION!"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Puerto-Rican P.O.W's statement: "I am Ferdinand Rodriguez...I agree with the Vietnamese people welcome the American people in the latter's struggle for an end to the war and equality right to Negroes and Puerto-Ricans. I wish to tell you that as a prisoner of war you will receive kind treatment..."
Includes Vietnamese translation.

did.unittitle: 9) "P.O.W. FERDINAND TO 25th INFANTRYMEN!"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Same as 8, in Rodriguez's handwriting. Includes Vietnamese translation.

did.unittitle: 10) "LETTER OF 3 U.S. P.O.W's TO DRIVERS IN THE U.S. ARMY IN S.V.N."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: "We are Thomas N. Jones...Kenneth R. Gregory...Bobby L Johnson...Johnson and his clique do not want to end this war...They are not over here dying and their family is not sheding [sic] tears...Johnson and his gang are making millions of dollars off of this unjust war...Demand an end to the war...Refuse to go out on operations but if you have to go, cross over to L.A.F....and you will receive good human and lenient treatment."
In Jones' handwriting, with other two signatures. Includes Vietnamese translation.

did.unittitle: 10A) "ANY G.I. MAY HAVE THE SAME LUCK!"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Names of three released P.O.W.s. "Those in the U.S. Army who cross over to the South Vietnamese people's side will be given kind treatment and helped to return to their families when conditions permit. Captured U.S. troops will be given the same kind treatment and lenient policy as captured Saigonese troops."
Includes statements of 2 P.O.W.s.

did.unittitle: 11) "STATEMENT OF 3 G.I's TAKEN P.O.W's BY THE L.A.F."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Similar to 10, in Gregory's handwriting, with other two signatures. Includes Vietnamese translation.

did.unittitle: 11A) "IMPRESSION OF US RELEASED P.O.W."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Gregory's statement when released, thanking for "lenient and humane policy towards foreign allied men and P.O.W.'s."

did.unittitle: 12) "FELLOW G.I's IN SOUTH VIETNAM!"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Similar to 10.
"...The reason we are alive now is because we crossed over to the L.A.F. at the first chance we had..."
Includes Vietnamese translation.

did.unittitle: 13) Leaflet with list of themes

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Summarized list of themes: "Demand end of war; Vietnam to Vietnamese; hands off the lives and property of the South Vietnamese people; the U.S. war of aggression will certainly be defeated; rise up and struggle; refuse to fight; surrender; desert; Negro G.I.s won't fight..."
Includes Vietnamese translation.

did.unittitle: 14) "ANY CAPTURED G.I. SOONER OR LATER MAY HAVE THE SAME LUCK!"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: List of 11 U.S. P.O.W's set free by the South Vietnam NFL; includes statements of 2 P.O.W's: MICHAEL F. OCONNOR and Mc KINLEY NOLAN.

did.unittitle: 14A) "Young American soldiers in Vietnam..."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Recto: Picture of American soldiers. "Young American soldiers in Vietnam / Their enemy is in Washington / You're not the only one who's sick of this war!"
Verso: "Private David Carnevale wrote home: 'I'm sick, sick of what I've done. And what has happened to my friends...Dad! I don't want to die! Please get me out of here!'"

did.unittitle: 15) "AMERICAN G.I's!"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: "Within two recent days (December 27-28, 1968) over 3,000 American officers and men in the 25th Inf. Div. stationed at Dong Du base camp (Cu-chi) simultanously [sic] rose up to oppose the war. They held high their banderoles and slogans demanding: -An immediate end to war -A withdrawal of U.S. troops from S.V.N....You should...resolutely refuse to go to the field..."
Includes Vietnamese translation.

did.unittitle: 16) "BRING ALL U.S. TROOPS HOME NOW!"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: "...Leave your firearms aside, Resolutely refuse to set out on operations, Demand immediate home return to your dear ones waiting for you."
Includes Vietnamese translation.

did.unittitle: 16A) a. "ALPHA COMPANY, 196th BRIGADE HAS SET AN EXAMPLE OF WAR RESISTANCE..."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: "...Follow its path. Show the brass you are men, not robots!"
Includes Vietnamese translation.

did.unittitle: 16A) b. "WELCOME TO G.I's WHO OPPOSE THE US AGGRESSIVE WAR IN SVN..."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: "...who don't kill the Vietnamese people, and demand an immediate withdrawal of all US troops from SVN!"
Includes Vietnamese translation.

did.unittitle: 17) "THE ANTI-WAR DEMONSTRATION IN THE UNITED STATES"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: "On April 6, 1969, the American people in over 40 cities staged the demonstration against the aggressive war in Vietnam, millions of the American peoples of all Work of life including whites, Negroes and an American Indian took part in the demonstration With many leaflets and slogans...Unite and protest...Sympathize with and support the Vietnamese peoples' struggle..."

did.unittitle: 17A) a. "WHEN IN CONTACT, CROSS OVER TO THE VIETNAMESE PEOPLE'S SIDE THEN YOU WILL BE KINDLY TREATED!"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes Vietnamese translation.

did.unittitle: 17A) b. "WELCOME TO G.I's OPPOSING THE US IMPERIALIST AGGRESSIVE WAR IN SOUTH VIETNAM AND DEMANDING THE WITHDRAWAL OF US TROOPS HOME!"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes Vietnamese translation.

did.unittitle: 17B) a. "WHAT MUST YEU [sic] DO TO RESTORE AN EARLY PEACE?"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: "In April 1969, a great number of American people...took to the street energetically demanding an end to this cruel and abominable war...G.I's, join in that lofty struggle...Let the Vietnamese people settle their own affairs themselves!"
Includes Vietnamese translation.

did.unittitle: 17B) b. "WHY AND FOR WHOM ARE YOU TEN THOUSAND MILES FROM HOME? G.I.'s!"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: "...Why has the US ruling circle sent you over here? Because they want much dollar profit from the Vietnam war..."

did.unittitle: 18) a. "AMERICAN G.I's!"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: "From the 1st to the 5th November, 1968, the 'U.S. Nation-Wide Committee for Demand of Ending the War of Aggression in Vietnam' hold a 'Nation-Wide Week of American Troops' to support your movement of anti-war of repatriation..."

did.unittitle: 18) b. "AMERICAN OFFICERS AND MEN"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: "...We appeal to you to refrain from interfering in the Vietnamese people's internal affairs and supporting the Thieu-Ky puppet administration in the suppression of our compatriots..."

did.unittitle: 18A) a. "1st CAVALLRYMEN!"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: "...the 1st Air Cav. Div. has completely failed not only in its attempt to block the Liberation Armed Forces from afar, resulting in abandonment of a number of positions in order to shrink back, but also in escaping heavy losses...G.I's in the Air Cav. Div.!...Don't be the last American to die in Vietnam!"
Includes Vietnamese translation.

did.unittitle: 18A) b. "G.I's IN THE 1st AIR CAVALRY DIVISION!"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: "What do you think of these words of condemnation hereupon: '...We denounce your escalation of this dirty war...' (Excerpts from 'A Motion to the Government of the United States' adopted by various P.O.W's including Captain Harold Kushner of the 1st Air Cav. Division)."

did.unittitle: 18B) "G.I's IN QUANG-TRI!"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: "Do you know that all US and South Vietnamese troops stationed at Khe-Sanh had hastily run away from this position on June 26, 1968?...There is no doubt the retreating of all US and puppet troops from Khe-Sanh is a so great setback of strategy of Johnson and his clique...To avoid a useless death you had better side with the American people and tell each other: Refuse to go to battle..."

did.unittitle: 18C) "U.S. TROOPS' SHAMEFUL WITHDRAWAL FROM KHE SANH BASE."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: "...Withdrawal from Khe Sanh is the heaviest failure of the US aggressors."

did.unittitle: 18D) a. "OFFICERS AND MEN IN THE 1st AIR CAV. DIV!

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: "Don't let the war-like ruling clique continues to deceive you and misuse your blood and sweat any more..."
Includes Vietnamese translation.

did.unittitle: 18D) b. "G.I's IN THE 1st AIR CAV. DIVISION!"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: "Thousands of American youngsters thus have continually fallen on the battlefield!"
Includes Vietnamese translation.

did.unittitle: 19) a. "U.S. OFFICERS AND MEN IN THE 25th INFANTRY DIVISION!"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: "...How many your buddies falled [sic] down and tax funds of the U.S. people wasted by the dirty war in South Vietnam? When day, the Nixon government still obsnate [sic] to prolong the aggressive war against South Vietnamese people then the People's Liberation Armed Forces still continue to launch many attacks which fiercer than these..."

did.unittitle: 19) b. "THE US SHOULD IMMEDIATELY BEGIN PULLING ITS TROOPS OUT OF VIETNAM WITH ALL POSSIBLE SPEED"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: "That was from a recent statement of Senator Mc Govern. He added: 'Haven't we had enough of this little tinhorn dictator Ky who wastes American tax funds and American blood in Vietnam!...'"
Includes Vietnamese translation.

did.unittitle: 19A) a. "WHAT MUST YOU DO TO RESTORE PEACE EARLY?"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Similar to 17B. Includes Vietnamese translation.

did.unittitle: 19A) b. "THE WAY TO AN HONORABLE SETTLEMENT FOR THE US"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: "Nixon deems it necessary to 'Des-Americanize' the Vietnam war...But in reality, he continues to blacken the image of America, to drive you out to kill and to be killed needlessly...For the US, the way to an honorable settlement is to withdraw all American and satellite troops out of Vietnam, to let the Vietnamese people settle their own affairs themselves..."
Includes Vietnamese translation.

did.unittitle: 19B) a. "RATHER BE JAILED BUT ABLE TO COME HOME THAN DIE IN VAIN IN SOUTH VIETNAM..."
19B) b. "...GIS REFUSE TO GO TO THE BATTLE FRONT"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: "...The best way to preserve your lives is not to interfere in our internal affairs..."

did.unittitle: 19B) c. "...AMERICAN GI'S UNITE AND PROTEST ALONGSIDE THE AMERICAN PEOPLE AGAINST NIXON's WAR IN VIETNAM..."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: "...The U.S. death toll is being multiplied by the Nixon administrations insistance [sic] that the aggressive war in Vietnam must go on..."

did.unittitle: 19C) "PROCLAMATION AMERICAN OFFICERS AND MEN. U.S. ALLIED OFFICERS AND MEN."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: "...the South Vietnam people of all strata have risen up to overthrow the present dictatorial corrupt administration, criminal of the merciless war which is heavily devastating their Fatherland. The Saigon administration is overthrown. It has now no legal nor practical power..."

did.unittitle: 20) "AN APPEAL TO U.S. SERVICEMEN IN VIETNAM"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Four P.O.W.'s statement: "U.S. Servicemen, we represent officers and men...who have been captured in various battles by the people's Liberation Armed Forces. Among us are Whites, Negroes, and an American Indian. We are very hopeful of the war ending soon so that we may return to our families and loved ones. But due to the stubborness [sic] of the present U.S. administration and their Saigon puppets, the war the needless suffering and slaughter of the Vietnamese people and our own American people continues to drag on..."

did.unittitle: 20A) "TO: OFFICERS AND MEN IN THE U.S., SOUTH KOREAN, AUSTRALIAN, THAI...ARMIES INVOLVED IN SOUTH VIETNAM"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: "...In their stormy general offensive and uprising the SVN people and army will continue dealing thunderbolt blows at U.S. imperialists and the Thieu-Ky clique in the time to come..."
Includes Vietnamese translation.

did.unittitle: 21) "THE SOUTH VIETNAM NATIONAL FRONT FOR LIBERATION GIVES LENIENT AND HUMANE TREATMENT TO CAPTURED G.I.s."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: "...American G.I.s! If you have seen the truth and are sincerely tired of this dirty and criminal war of aggression, seek a way in combat to cross over..." Includes statements of 3 P.O.W.s.

did.unittitle: 21A) a. "WHAT MUST YEU [sic] DO TO RESTORE AN EARLY PEACE?" (same as 17B)
21A) b. "WHAT MUST YOU DO TO RESTORE PEACE EARLY?" (similar to 17B)
21A) c. "AMERICAN G.I.s!"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: "Whether Anello - one of your fellow soldiers...is still alive or like hundreds of thousands of other ill-fated GI's died in the South Vietnam battle-field. But Anello's words in his diary will offer you alot [sic] of help: 'A smile, but no ones smiling. A laugh, but no ones laughing...' Friends! Anello has exposed the hatred of war and the tiredness of life of the Americans in Vietnam..." Includes cartoon.

did.unittitle: 21B) "TO OFFICERS ARD MEN IN THE DIV"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: "The war waged by the U.S. government in Vietnam has been come into Complete failure...Many U.S. congressmen also said that 'the war must be stopped; withdrawn U.S. troops home; the peace must be restored in Vietnam'..."

did.unittitle: 21C) "OFFICERS AND MEN IN THE US ARMED FORCES IN SOUTH VN!"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: "On June 8, 1969 the national congress of the people's representatives of SVN consisting of representatives of people of all walks of life...has formed the provisional revolutionary government of SVN headed by president Huynh Tan Phat...American GI's! There is no reason for you to be here in SVN 'to fight under the oppressive weather and muddy soil for the existence of a couple of men in Saigon presidential residence' (E. Kennedy)..."
Includes Vietnamese translation.

did.unittitle: 21D) "THE WAY TO AN HONORABLE SETTLEMENT FOR THE U.S."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Similar to 19A. Includes Vietnamese translation.

did.unittitle: 21E) "BEING ALIVE AND SENT HOME!"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Recto: "How many men lost their lives?...That is only because of Nixon's warlike policy of agonizingly slow pace of withdrawal and of war prolongation...OUT NOW AND ALIVE!"
Includes Vietnamese translation.
Verso: Drawing of an American woman crying over American soldiers' graveyards, with anti-war protesters in the background.

did.unittitle: 22) a. "THIS IS YOUR FREE TICKET OUT"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: "...How to get out of here alive. The answer is: Let yourself be captured..."

did.unittitle: 22) b. "THERE IS NO HATRED AMONG THE VIETNAMESE PEOPLE AND YOUR OWN ONES. SO WHY ARE YOU KILLING THE VIETNAMESE?"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes Vietnamese translation.

did.unittitle: 23) "TO ANTI-WAR AMERICAN SERVICEMEN!"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: "We warmly welcome American G.I's who, for the sake of America's honor and human conscience, resolutely oppose the aggressive war waged by U.S imperialism in South Vietnam!...To help us differentiate you from the stubborn thugs fighting us, you should do as follows..."
Includes a "FAVORABLE TREATMENT BILL FOR ANTI-WAR G.I's" and Vietnamese translation.

did.unittitle: 23A) Thank-you letter of P.O.W. Richard Gordon Burgess for medical attention.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Recto: Thank-you letter of P.O.W. Richard Gordon Burgess for medical attention.

Verso: "The US has no business in Vietnam said Marine General '...I believe that if we keep our dirty, bloody-dollar-crooked fingers out of the business of these nations so full of exploited people, they will arrive at a solution of their own...' General David M. Shoup."

did.unittitle: 24) a. "POLICY TOWARD US AND SATELLITE POWs IN SOUTH VIETNAM"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: "Base on the humanitarian and lenient policy of the SVN-NFL, the High Command of the SVN-LA has stipulated the following points:..." (on P.O.W. treatment).

did.unittitle: 24) b. "THE SOUTH VIETNAM NFL GIVES LENIENT AND HUMANE TREATMENT TO CAPTURED G.I's."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Recto: "To welcome puppet officers and soldiers and puppet officials back to the just cause..."
Verso: "How to surrender or to cross over to the NFL's side..."
Includes Vietnamese translation.

did.unittitle: 24A) a. "WHEN CLASHED, THROW AWAY YOUR ARMS, CROSS OVER TO THE P.L.A.F's SIDE, YOU WILL BE WELL TREATED"
24A) b. "SAFE-CONDUCT PASS"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Safe-conduct for someone who "wishes to live under protection of NFL."

did.unittitle: 24B) "IT'S A HELL OF A LIFE"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: "Inside the base:
-Tropical Heat!
-Over-Strain!
-Disease!
Ourside [sic] the base:
-Mosquitoes...
-A Hand-Grenade may be tossed at you...
There is no safe place for you! Because: you are being forced to fight an unjust war..."

did.unittitle: 24C) "TO: AMERICAN AND SATELLITE SERVICEMEN WOUNDED IN BATTLEFIELD!"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: "...Having been granted humane treatment by the L.A.F., you should dwell on the crimes against the Vietnamese people perpetrated by you and your buddies..."
Includes Vietnamese translation.

did.unittitle: 24D) a. Released POW's 1969 letter found in Pentagon by his family

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: "Don't be too alarmed but this is me (John Sexton Jr). I am not dead..." (in John Sexton Jr.'s handwriting).
